Neither of us felt the menu was special enough to come back.

I don't know why this place only has 3 stars. It was so good! We were originally going to go for the ayce sushi but there was an hour wait. So glad we ordered from the regular menu instead! My fave appetizers were the Korean tacos and the duck sliders! So yummy. The duck sliders are a little pricey tho, about $6 per. But for me, it was worth it! The kimchi fried rice and the filet medallions were the highlights of the meal. Didn't get to try dessert because I was so full. Next time!

We were really looking forward to eating here since we're from the local area and love the M but it was a huge disappointment.    The service was TERRIBLY slow, the food was bland and the sushi bar blocks the best view of the strip.  After being seated, we waited almost 20 minutes just to order drinks.  When our order arrived, the waiter spilled my martini on my Coach purse.  The waiter apologized and said he'd be right back with something to clean it up.  No big deal, accidents happen.  However, it took 10 (!!!!) minutes for him to bring a napkin & selzer water.  They didn't even comp the drink despite half of it being spilled on my purse!!    The rest of the night pretty much followed suit...we ordered the street taco appetizer, a plate of the ribs (a specialty of the chef apparently) and 2 entrees.  The app came out right away and was tasty but a little cold.  Then the ribs followed quickly and were also pretty good.  But after that, things went downhill again.  It took almost 30 minutes to get the beef & noodle dish my husband ordered.  It wasn't even anything special--just noodles with marinated beef strips.  Then almost another 20 minutes after hi meal arrived for snapper I ordered to show up.  The snapper had no flavor.  Very disappointing!  Over 2 hours later we still weren't out of there.  But this isn't one of those fancy restaurants where you should take your time and a meal should take 2 hours...this was just pure delay by the staff (kitchen or wait staff, we're not sure) and poor service.  The M has much better choices...save your money & time and go somewhere else.
Great food at reasonable prices! We even got to meet the signature chef! Went there to celebrate my birthday!
The all you can eat sushi bar for $24 is well worth it! Delicious big rolls with excellent flavor. Service was excellent. Free saki with the meal!

I've been to a lot of sushi places, and this may have been one of the more disappointing ones. Maybe it's because my family and I had high expectations, but the setting and vibe you get from just looking at the restaurant can't let you think anything less of it. As it turns out, it was kind of the opposite.   There are three different AYCE menus: sushi & nigiri, Jayde Fuzion specialties (lemon chicken, lettuce wraps, gyoza, etc.), and then sushi, nigiri & specialties all in one. Four out of five of us at the table chose the sushi & nigiri menu, and we all agreed on one thing - the texture and quality of the rice for the rolls was WAY different than the rice for the nigiri, and not in a good way. It was mushy and undercooked at the same time. It stuck to the top of the roof of your mouth when you chewed it, and it was unappetizing after one or two pieces. Bottom line, we couldn't stomach them. We asked our server why there was a difference with the rice, and the answer to our question after he consulted with the chefs was that there was more rice vinegar at the roll station in comparison to the one placed at the nigiri station.   In our opinion, the nigiri rice was the consistency it was supposed to be. They made a roll with the nigiri rice to see if it would make a difference to us, and of course, it did. It was the way we all thought it SHOULD be, but as I said, our appetites were already lost.  Thankfully, our servers were so considerate and understanding. They offered if we would like to switch to the specialties menu due to our dissatisfaction, they informed the chefs about the rice, and apologized for any inconvenience. I must say the specialties menu was much better than the sushi & nigiri. The fried rice, honey walnut prawns and lettuce wraps were good and dessert did the job.  Originally, I was going to give this place only one star, but customer service pleased my family and I, which is the reason I gave it two instead. Yes, food is the primary concern here, but bad service can throw that out of the window even if the food was amazing. I would've given three if at least one of our meals were comp'd, but oh well.  All in all, I've experienced better. Give it a try, because every place is worth that much. Hopefully after our comments, the rolls will get better.

This restaurant is one of the best. I have eaten at different sushi and Chinese/Asian restaurants but I have never thought how great of idea of combining the two. I know the pricing is on the higher end. But when in Vegas most things cost more. I'm happy to say that i am willing to pay the extra price because the service and ambiance is top notch. Service staff is trained and meets all the customer demands. Our waiter, Raymond, was friendly and was glad to meet all of our needs. All you can eat with out that buffet feel. Make sure to ask for the honey candy walnut.

I have wanted to come here since I saw Jade win on the Food Network,  but I am disappointed.  Maybe what I ordered wasn't a special enough dish.  I had hot and sour soup,  it was mediocre.  The service was also not outstanding.  Perhaps I have to try a different dish to be impressed.  Maybe I will give it one more try.
We went here again on Christmas for the second time and it did not disappoint.  Our service was great and the food was awesome and it just kept coming.

Their appetizers are delicious but their nigiris are mostly rice. We always go to AYCE in LV and the amount of rice here is way too much! Their miso soup, tempura, bao and Vietnamese rolls are tasty. We asked for green tea and it was a tea bag and we kept on asking for hot water to refill it. They also don't clear the tables after the small dishes. They let them pile up and just keep bringing in your orders. We didn't have space anymore and there were only 2 of us on a table for 4. The service was ok but it was kinda snobbish feel. The signs on the freeway made us try it but that was our first and last. Sorry.

This review is for AYCE Jayde specialties menu only. My sweets and I ate here while staying at the M and we will never eat here again.  We are not fans at all.  This was probably the saddest dining experience I have ever had.  The service was fine but the cocktails and food were very disappointing.  I was excited for the all you can eat since the menu sounded great with some yummy options.  The portions were huge which I did not expect or want.  I was hoping for small plates so I could try a few different items.  By the time I ate my first appetizer I was full.  Here is what we tried.....  -Shrimp Tempura-nothing special and the batter was hard, I can make better tempura at home  -Chicken Lettuce cups-no spices at all and the chicken was watery...........sooooooo bland  -Chow fun noodles-sauce was ok but lacked basil. The beef was poor quality and reminded us of dog food!!!! It was disgusting.  -Chow Mein-ok  -Beef with broccoli-again, the beef tasted like dog food.  I would have given this place one star but we did not try the sushi.  Maybe that is the reason this place has 3 stars.

Don't believe the bad reviews. If you notice they don't ever mentioned bad food quality. I eat here every Wednesday and have never had a bad experience. Every visitor I've brought here has loved it. Yes, it's Americanized, but the preparation as well as service is solid. If you want customized sushi, sit at the bar. They will accommodate your special request at the tables as well. It is better to come here with a group of four or more so everyone can share and that way you can try more of the selection. When my wife and I come we either get the sushi or we get the appetizers. When we come with friends we all get the fusion so we can share everything. All the food is extremely fresh and for $25 a person you cannot beat the value.

Asian fusion tapas is how I would best describe Jayde Fuzion and Seonkyoung, the new Food Network star surely delivered with her culinary vision and concepts!  My advice is to go in a group of 4 and order a bunch of dishes and share.   We loved the Crab Salad - I believe this was one of the dishes featured in the early episode of Restaurant Express.  The salad was so fresh, light and refreshing.  The crab salad is paired with these lettuce endives and sesame wonton chips to scoop the crab goodness up.  This was one of our favorites.  You can't go wrong with the lettuce wraps stuffed with pork belly....YES....pork belly.  Next time I will get the Duck sliders and Korean street tacos as we saw many tables having these dishes.    There are many traditional Korean dishes such as Japchae and Kalbi and for less adventurous eaters you can order a cashew chicken.  There's an even a full blown sushi bar.    There's definitely something for everyone.   The best part is most entrees are in the $8 to $15 range so you can order several and share.  Be sure to save room for desserts.  We really enjoyed the Yuzu Donuts - I could eat a dozen of those.  Hopefully chef will bring her famous sticky Asian bbq Ribs.  If you're in the area, be sure to check out this new Asian gem at the M Resort.

All you can eat menu is a great value. I ordered the sushi and nigiri. My husband had the jayde specialties (Cantonese). The sushi roll choices are a bit limited and best I could tell they have a group of sushi chefs continually churning out rolls so you don't have to wait long. We got right in, no wait on a Friday night. Our server was knowledgable and very pleasant. Decor is nice too. Portions are generous. For an all-you-can-eat menu I would almost prefer smaller dishes so I have an opportunity to sample more items.  Kids under 5 eat free! Ages 5-12 are half off.

My absolute favorite sushi spot in Vegas so far. Quality of the fish is excellent and each of their dishes I have tried are delicious. The ambiance is very nice and is great for date nights or just lunch with friends. Service was also on point. The menu consists of 3 different types of all-you-can-eat choices, which I can't remember off the top my head!   Check em out, you won't regret it!

We were very impressed with our experience. The food was absolutely amazing, wonderful flavor, and presentation. Also very pleased with the service of the staff, everyone was very nice and helpful, esp coming from someone who works in the service industry I can 100% say we enjoyed our experience. We will be back! Thank you !

Went here last night for AYCE at the sushi bar. I was originally going to order ramen and our waiter was pretty adamant that it was not good and instead recommended other soups for me to try. I've had waiters recommend different items before, but none had ever been so blatant as this guy. I appreciated his opinion yet at the same time felt it was incredibly strange being warned not to order a specific dish. So I took his advice and opted for the AYCE sushi.  We enjoyed their AYCE menu. The various appetizers, nigiri, and two rolls we ordered were all quite good. Both the sushi and nigiri were rather large, meaning big individual pieces with a lot of rice. I tend to prefer smaller pieces so that I can try a larger variety of items rather than getting full so easily on larger portions.  Another tiny negative was that we had to wait a few minutes for the hostess to appear. Obviously it is quite normal to have to wait for your table, but someone should always be up front to take your name down or at least greet you. I don't think I've ever seen a dine-in restaurant with a completely empty hostess stand before and just found it very unusual.  I thought the food and atmosphere overall was nice, but something about the experience was just a bit off. I personally had a good time, so I'm not sure to be honest. But I would be happy to come here again and give the a la carte menu a try (prices look pretty good).

We've been coming here since its opening & we were very disappointed with the new changes. My husband & I live within minutes & have enjoyed coming for drinks, an appetizer, & sharing an entree. Now it's all you can eat for $25+taxes for anything.  There is no longer an option to order individual items. We can't eat that much &, from the looks of the empty restaurant at 6:30 on a Friday night, others agree.  Too bad - we won't be back.

My Cousin recommended this place to have dinner, we haven't seen each other for a long while, but we are always wanting to try new restaurants when we have our moments to reconnect and share about what's going on with our lives currently.  She's also good friends with one of the chefs. Customer service wise : from the hostess to our waiter was excellent! Very attentive and knowledgeable of all the food offerings displayed on the very quaint menu books.  The menu itself is basic and simple but our waiter Alex was knowledgable about every item we inquired about.  Drinks were served In a timely manner, and we placed our order shortly after. I assumed that we arrived early enough before the dinner crowd arrived that our dining experience happened so flawlessly.  When our food arrived, the lounge started to populate. We assumed we dined at a great time.  The food was beyond amazing, plated wonderfully, eye appealing, and full of flavor.  I would recommend this place as a meet and greet or a time to have an intimate meal with conversation - not a place for a family for the reason that the menu emanates "Ala Carte".    :)

My favorite restaurant at the M Resort.  Excellent, friendly, attentive service.  Good sushi, especially for an AYCE place.  EXCELLENT non-sushi food. The Korean Street Tacos were truly sublime.  Very reasonable prices as well. There's not many places in Vegas two people can have a dinner that large with booze for under $80.

So after months spent bookmarked on my yelp. I finally made it to seonkyoungs restaurant. Ambiance is modern upscale yet casual friendly. Crowd was a lil more of the mature side. I came in with my fianc and son but nonetheless we didn't care lol. Now lets talk food & service.   We ordered a lot of things so I might not remember all.   -dumplings: came out cold so I sent it back and got better ones. They are ok. -duck sliders: super yummy! I can eat 10 of these. -rock shrimp: it was good tempura shrimp but just a tad much on the breading.  -Korean tacos: eh. comes deconstructed. I had better.  -lettuce wraps: not enough pork belly and why put rice in it? It's a lettuce wrap.. -fried chicken skewers: these are perfectly cooked tenders w a nice sweet n spicy sauce.  -wonton soup: normal. -blue fin tuna nigiris & toro sashimi: I like the generous portion of the nigiri. The toro sashimi wasn't cut of restaurant quality and the fish didn't taste fresh.  -yuzu ritas: delicious rendition of a margarita. Try it!  -green tea brle: it was very good but needs help on presentation. -white chocolate strawberry yuzu mousse: pretty unique dessert & beautiful plating.   Service was friendly but slow.   Some of the dishes are good but majority of it is forgettable. Nothing is screaming at me "come back".

Service good and they make an effort to cater to your needs but when they are busy it can get chaotic and there can be waits. As for their all you can eat menu - they have a very limited selection even with the different options. We did prefer the side dishes vs the actual sushi.

After our first experience we were invited back by the chef. We tried it again and my, what a difference!  We received exceptional service and the fish was the highest quality AYCE sashimi I have ever had. The sashimi alone was worth the price tag. I would highly recommend this restaurant fortheit sushi, sashimi, or any of their other offerings. Their customer service was amazing and the quality of the food was exceptional!

My hubby and I went here last night, I wanted to try this since it opened.  We had a 6PM reservation and showed up early...no problems.  They seated us at a table for two and suggested a few menu items.  They also told us wine was 1/3 off for bottles, so we got a bottle of sav blanc for only 23 dollars.  We ordered the Korean tacos, Kalbi ribs and Chow fun.  We have been to Korea, and this was spot on!  Hubby loved his chow fun, and I enjoyed the kalbi....the Korean tacos were a little cold, but they still tasted very good with fresh veggies and the sauce.  Probably the only reason I am not giving this place five stars.  Our waiter was just fantastic, and he allowed us to take our wine onto the floor after dinner in their nice wine glasses.  We love the M casino and now we know about this gem....will definitely return!
I really like this place when I'm starving. The ability to get sushi and other foods is awesome. They have a great plum wine you should try!!

The food was pretty good. Rolls were filling & tasty & nigiri was fresh. There was no line to eat, unlike studio B, which is where we were heading. We are sushi eaters, so coming here was a fantastic alternative. The ambiance was cool & romantic. The staff was helpful, friendly, & quick. Plus, we got hot sake & it was good.  A strange complaint would be the chop sticks literally gave me a splinter. I mentioned this to the waiter & he explained they had ran out & had to use a lower quality utensil. Which is completely understandable. Overall, we had a very pleasant experience.

The all you can eat hot and cold option is a great deal. Food is really good and service is usually pretty good too. My fave is the korean street tacos and the walnut shrimp. On some occasions they even have an off the menu item that they will offer at no additional charge...last time I was there it was a whole fish Thai style. The only thing that I would add is you get free sake with some of the special all you can eat dinners but often you have to ask them or they do not bring it. So just ask.
Very poor quality of sushi. Don't bother. The options were not exciting, and the quality is not worth it. Better off at Studio B.

After doing some shopping, hubby and I decided on coming here to Jayde Fuzion for dinner. We didn't leave hungry! We were greeted with a warm welcome and our server was fast as we sat at the table to get our drink order. The service was excellent here. Our drinks never went empty and our server answered all of our questions.  The menu is very simple without having a ton of items on it, but it was still hard to decide was to order since it all looked so good. The prices are also very reasonable. We decided to get different items from the menu and just share it.   Chicken Lettuce Wraps ($8) - These were pretty good. I personally prefer a crunchier lettuce, but it was good. The menu said this dish was spicy however there wasn't any kick to the dish all. The chicken still had good flavor and it is worth the price. It came with 3 lettuce cups and when I asked our server for more it was no problem.  Cashew Chicken ($15) - My favorite dish of them all! It was a great portion of chicken and put over white rice it was perfect. There were plenty of cashews and this is a dish I would probably order every time.   Gochujang Pork ($15) - Apples are in this dish, but I didn't taste them. That's OK because whatever flavor it did give the pork, I loved! I will say that this was also supposed to be a spicy dish and there was again no kick at all. It's sort of frustrating when a dish says it will be spicy and it isn't, but it did have great flavor and I would eat it again. As with the other dishes it was a decent portion.   Honey Walnut Shrimp ($18) - I don't eat seafood. I didn't try these! The menu says it was supposed to have a creamy mayo sauce, but hubby said the shrimp tasted more like a really sweet orange and wouldn't order them again. I thought they were presented well and nicely sized.   Yuzu Doughnuts ($7) - These are yummy! The doughnuts are very light and not greasy at all. The doughnuts were filled with tasty yuzu glaze and more glaze with pistachios were on top. The refreshing citrus flavor and light texture of the doughnuts made for a nice dessert.   They didn't open until 5 pm (when we happened to arrive) and people were already waiting to get in. You might want to call ahead and make a reservation. And come hungry! There is also a sushi bar.

No a la carte menu here but the sushi is good and a good all you can eat price!  We took a chance on this spot while gambling at the M. I wasn't sure what I was walking in to so we grabbed a seat at the bar and asked for a menu. The bartender explained that they only did all you can eat and had two choices to select the cheaper one being about $25 and the other choice included sashimi for $35. Both choices include lots of different rolls, appetizers and other choices.   My husband wasn't that hungry so we had originally wanted to order a few rolls for myself and an appetizer for him but since we couldn't do that she explained that I could order take out for the $35 price and pick 6 things off the menu and then just eat them at the bar together. This sounded a little weird to me but since we were already here and sushi sounded delicious we took the chance.   I ordered 4 rolls including soft shell crab, the M girl a shrimp tempura and a Spicy Tuna. We also ordered the pork ribs and chicken lettuce wraps for our last two of the six choices. Once the food came it felt a little awkward eating out of plastic containers at the bar but that's what we were told we could do.The sushi was really tasty. It all tasted fresh, had good flavor and was served in full roll portions. The ribs had good flavor but did not come with a sauce and the chicken lettuce wraps were just average to me. They didn't come with a sauce either and the chicken seemed a little dry.  I would come back here with hungry people to try their AYCE sushi menu in the dining room. The menu had a large selection of things on it including tacos, chow mein, shrimp tempura, edamame, regular rolls and sashimi. I think the price was good for the amount of food served and the service was pretty good too.

Jayde is located inside M resort. When I just walked into the restaurant, I was impressed by all the flowers inside the glass wall on each side of entrance hallway. I started my meal with cocktail Yuzu Rita. I am a fan of everything made with yuzu. However, I didn't enjoy this drink very much. It tasted artificial and lacked refreshing citrus flavor. I had 5 spiced duck sliders as appetizer. I didn't like this dish at all. There was no 5 spiced flavor. All I tasted was lots hoisin sauce. I also had chef's famous dish, bibimbap. It was very good! It was plating in very artistic way. I love the shiitakes in this dish. I also ordered Korean style lobster. It was very flavorful. Lobster was perfectly cooked and succulent. My only complaint would probably be its sauce. It was a bit too salty to me. I also tried seafood soup. Flavor of soup was okay. There wasn't anything special. For desserts, I had lychee ice cream and white chocolate strawberry mousse cake. Both were excellent! I had lots lychee sorbet in my life, but never had lychee ice cream before. It was light and creamy. I really enjoyed chef added some crunchiness in this dish. Strawberry mousse came in very beautiful presentation. It was made with just right amount of sweetness. Price is reasonable here. Service is very friendly and welcoming. I bump Jayde up from 3.5 to 4 stars for its great service and delicious desserts.

Went to for the all you can eat sushi, was disappointed by the limited menu and the overall quality. There are better options for all you can eat sushi in Vegas.  Really great view of the city from the bar though...

Kind of a weird dining experience.  Perhaps they are still working out the kinks?  First, I checked out the menu and saw there were basically no vegetarian options.  So, I asked the person at the front if they have vegetarian food.  She said they can make a vegetarian version of lots of stuff.  I asked if they can make the lettuce wraps vegetarian.  She said no.  We tried it anyway because we were on the brink of dying of starvation, the line for the buffet was a trillion miles long, and the wait at Anthony's Burgers & Brews was 30 minutes.  I asked the server what vegetarian options they have.  She said they can make 90% of the menu vegetarian.  I asked if they can make vegetarian lettuce wraps, she said no.  I looked at the menu.  Hmm.  Not sure how you'd make salmon, lobster, or chicken vegetarian.  So, the "90%" thing is definitely not true.  I decided on the chow mein without meat.  There were no offers to sub with tofu or anything.  My brother asked again, is there any way they can just make the lettuce wraps with tofu instead of meat?  Our server checked with the chef, and, miracles of miracles, they were able to do it.  Awesome, but weird that we basically had to beg them to try.  I also tried the veggie rolls.  Nothing special, I'd skip it next time.  The food was all okay - nothing amazing, but the prices were pretty good for a Casino restaurant in Vegas.  The made a mistake on one thing and fixed it right away.  The chef came over to ask how everything was, I told her they should put more vegetarian stuff on the menu.  She said they can make most of the things on the menu without meat.  Oy, for the millionth time, JUST PUT IT ON THE MENU THEN!  (I did not watch Restaurant Express and therefore was not star struck by the chef, she was nice though.)

Solid deal for solid fish - not blow your mind good, but fresh enough to do the trick and be well worth it for $24.99 including sake for all. We had access to the whole sushi menu, which made it easy to order anything we wanted - a lot of AYCE places stratify the fish and do a lot of add-ons for better rolls, etc. Of the rolls I liked Surf and Turf the most, while everything else was about in line with what you would expect.   For an off-off-off Strip hotel, I was impressed with the quality of the food throughout M Resort, and Jayde was no exception.

This is one of our favorite places to eat when we are in Vegas on business. Now they are exclusively an all you can eat restaurant. They offer both hot food and sushi. Both menus are great. I really enjoyed their sushi rolls and everyone who ordered hot food loved it as well. Their sushi would be even better if it had less rice. The service you receive depends on the server you have. One server we have gotten several times (I wish I could remember his name) is really great and makes it a really pleasant experience. One time we went we got someone else and he wasn't super friendly, but the food was still really good. As far as all you can eat sushi goes, it is delicious.

I brought my hubby here for a pre V day dinner. It wasn't so bad. Food was great. I had made my reservation online. The hosts up front need to have a little bit more class, if you ask me. They brought us to our table and my husband thought it to be a lil small, which he was right. So the host asked us to return to the front and wait until the table next to us would take "5" minutes to clean up and prepare. Well that "5"minutes turned out to be "25" minutes. Once seated, our server was great and the food was great also. I would definitely return and bring my family too.
Restaurant looks great and spacious.   Menu is a bit limited for an AYCE sushi.  Comes with sake the AYCE.  Any additions are extra.  Does not have any ala carte options.   Great ambience.

First time eating at Jayde and it was a great experience. The dining room is spacious with a great view and wonderful ambiance. We ate off the specialty menu and there was a huge selection of items. Everything we had was delicious! Too bad our eyes were bigger than our stomachs! I can't wait to go back and try other items we couldn't get to. The service was also wonderful! We had Sean, Tyler and Jesus assisting and they all were very professional, helpful, speedy and made our first time dining at Jayde a great night out! We will definitely be returning!

Excellent!We ordered the all you can eat and they do not skimp on the quality and quantity is amazing. The salt and pepper crab legs were delicious and easy to extract. Our server Ian was attentive and always made sure were kept happy and full. It was our first time there and we are new and continuing customers.

I can't write about the food, because I left before we even got sat. But we got there at 6, and at that point, it was a potentially an hour wait. We had issues with even giving the hostess our phone number. I walked away thinking that I wouldn't even get called due to the fact that she kept getting our number wrong. Sure enough, after 40 min, we went back to see how long the wait was, and she apologized. She apologized that she called our number and it was the wrong number. She would seat as soon as she could. That turned into another 45 min. We joined a group of people leaving for the same reason. The wait. I'm sure the food is good, but I didn't get the chance to try it. We went to Anthony's and got sat right away. Great food. Great service. The only thing was the selection was minimal for $25. Even Sushi Mon had a better selection for $21.

Wow this place was great.  We had the all you can eat and everything tasted amazing and delicious and was well made.   The Orange Crush was great as were the korean tacos and the ribs were very flavorful and delicious..The Blue Lagoon cocktail was great and went well with our food.  Our waiter Matt was very attentive and helpful when it came to making our selections.  Consider us repeat customers.

Why did i come back here? Because they had all-you-can-eat sushi and i figured why not give it a whirl. Bad idea! Im surprised people are saying this stuff is any good, but then again quite a few people dont really have a clue either.   - Fresh Water Eel - Weird texture, and tasted fatty or oily in the skin - Spicy tuna - Very off texture and lacking  - Surf & Turf roll - A MESS of SAUCE...just drenched in sauce that i couldnt eat it  - All rolls with sauce - Too much sauce!   The nigiri is the only thing i finished with given its hard to mess that up since there isnt any sauce, its just simple rice and fish. If you must go here, stick this route for your own good. As for the management, fill your soy sauce bottles! Around the ENTIRE sushi bar we have a total of a combined half bottle of soy, spread over the 6 bottles at the bar.

I used to be a Palazzo Hotel guest regular until I discovered M Resort Hotel...c'mon free comp room..now how could anyone pass that up right?  =)  The Studio B buffet  is a great staple but really wanted to try Jayde Fuzion.  I watched a few episode of Food Network "Restaurant's Express and so that's how i knew of the Executive Chef for this restaurant. Of course it was a plus she was Korean...gotta support my peoples :)  We arrived right when they opened (5pm) so there was no wait! As i skimmed through the menu, i saw alot of authetic korean dishes in which was awesome. I was quite interested in seeing how they would execute the taste since I grew up with Korean food. The portions were smaller than i'm used to but the flavor of everything was superb! This is what we ordered:  Korean Lobster-This dish reminded me of many chinese type dishes i've had in the past with the usual ginger and soy sauce base flavor but i love how they added a twist by making it korean, as it's name, by adding some korean pork, spices and veggies. There wasn't that much lobster pieces but in other restaurant dishes....they really isn't in the first place. I would definately eat this again...but maybe next time i'll order two for just myself..oink oink! Pork Wrap-This was a fancy upgrade to what i'm used to, Samgyupsal (korean name for it). It tasted the similar but again with special additional ingredients.  Nice appetizer instead of just a salad. They give you four pieces.  Kalbi Rib-This was sweeter than the normal kalbi i'm used to. The beef quality was great but i wasn't really digging the extra sweetness. You can definately taste the kalbi that you usually eat but with a thicker teriyaki like sauce. I would've like them to have brought this out with white rice or something to neutralize the sweetness. Kimchee Fried Rice-This was my absolute favorite of the dishes! OMG it's just like mom makes it but this extra spice/seasoning that kicks you to want more in your mouth. CRACK would be a better word. More please?!?!?!?!?  Since it seems like they have mostly korean dishes, i wish the name and decor was more "korean" themed though.They have the green for chinese and the cherry blossoms for japanese......Oh well maybe later if they ever remodel. =)

When I think AYCE sushi for less than $35, my expectations are set to the lowest of the low.  However, after dining here the other night, I was pleasantly surprised.  No, you are not going to get high-end, top notch, melt in your mouth sushi, but it was pretty good. The fish was not at all fish-y and the cuts was pretty big.    AYCE Sushi for $24.95 AYCE Jayde Specialties for $24.95  or AYCE Everything for $32.95  Jayde specialties are pretty much asian dishes- from kogi tacos to fried rice, dumplings, calamari and so on.    I love sushi, so I went for their AYCE sushi menu.  I ordered 2 cut rolls, 1 albacore, 2 salmon, 2 unagis, 1 yellowtail, and 1 ikura.  Was super full and I think it was totally worth the $24.95 price. My friends pretty much ordered everything on the Jayde menu and their favorite was the Kogi Tacos and fried rice.  Think of this place in comparison to Kabuki, Yamato, and those other small, cheap Japanese restaurants.

The food was pretty average. Fortunately the prices were reasonable so I felt it was fair.  They are lacking on the custom cocktail department.  The bar made a decent gimlet however.  The best thing we had was the geisha roll.

Peaceful atmosphere, great view of the city, great service and delicious food.  I haven't been to too many places like this. For ~$30 per person, you can get unlimited Asian dishes and sushi/nigiri.  It's like a buffet except the food is brought to you fresh!  They have a menu that you can just keep ordering items from.   Whenever we have people in town, this is always one of the places we take them too!  Highly recommended!
All you can eat either sushi, hit plates or combination. We decided for hit plates. The Korean tacos and ribs were my favorite. Mochi us awesome too

Server Sean is busy watching football game rather than providing a basic service.  He doesn't know how to say sorry when a customer nicely complains.  Sushi rice was missing venager and no one is ready accept.  Do NOT go here unless you are desperate to eat in M hotel only because the buffet line wait is too long.  NEVER coming back!!!

Let me first disclose that I did not even get to eat there.  This one star is for the heavily advertised 'ALL YOU CAN EAT' with included Sake on billboards along St. Rose highway, as well as on signs throughout the M property.  I have tried to eat here (just the all you can eat) twice to no avail.  When you go there, they only offer it at the bar/counter (not even the entire bar, just one half of it) and are asked to wait if it is full (and it always is, because the seating is so limited!).  Nevermind that the rest of the dining area is open with lots of seats, they will only offer it at the bar.  Also, if there is a wait, you must wait there or lose your place.  They have no waiting list, nothing to take names, and the hostess just assures you that she'll remember who arrived first.  It really makes no sense.  I almost gave in to be seated in the restaurant and simply order off the regular menu, but because this was my second crack at this place, I was completely turned off, and didn't even want to eat there at all.  Perhaps this sounds like sour grapes, and maybe it is, but for as HEAVILY as they advertise the All You Can Eat option, they provide really no availiability.

This review is solely based on their AYCE sushi.   When we got here the place was very quiet and not alot of people were eating. We have been so excited to try this place but haven't gotten around to it and finally saw the huge billboard and took it as a sign to eat here.   When we first were greeted the hostess took us to the back and was going to sit us at the bar. We asked if we could get a table instead and she said well no all the sushi is eaten at the bar. Then we looked around and saw a few other tables that people were eating sushi at.  Shen then proceeded to say that she could seat us at a table but that "It would be more convenient for us in case we get a group of 4 or something". This was told to us even though there was only 3 other tables occupied out of the maybe 30 they have.   Regardless we sat at the bar and ordered away. The pork buns and eggrolls were delicious but that it pretty much where it ends.  The selection of rolls was extremely limited and had maybe 10 options to choose from. I get it, they were made with good ingredients but nothing tasted extraordinary to be a good sushi AYCE place.   The chefs that were preparing it seemed miserable and no smiles at all when the sushi was brought to us.   If I wanted mediocre sushi and frowning faces, I would have easily just gone to a closer place for a cheaper price instead of driving all the way out the the M for this kind of service.  Also, unfortunately, there is not dessert that is included in the AYCE menu :/ So disappointed in this. May come back and order from regular menu but never again for the sushi AYCE. There are better, cheaper, more delicious options out there.

We went to try the all you can eat and were very disappointed. We waited an hour since you can only sit at the tiny bar.  Then the menu was extremely limited.  I've been to many all you can eat sushi restaurants and I wouldn't recommend for the all you can eat. Price not worth it. I haven't tried the full restaurant yet, but not a top priority now
So very slow... good food.. understaffed.. paid our check and still waiting for our last roll! HELP

Fantastic entrance ambiance ! And then ... they put sushi bar instead of tables in front of amazing strip view ...  Toooo much sake me designer what a fail !  Food : we have tried two out of three all you can eat menu .   It really isn't the high quality food you would expect from place with such a nice ambiance   Attentive stuff very nice stuff and extremely helpful but ... they really don't give you a lot of privacy at the tables they will literally check on you every 120 seconds and grab stuff straight out of your table in the middle of conversations- #neednewmanagement

Great ambiance, nice view, definitely some great options on non sushi foods. The sushi is ok but they could learn a few good things from " I love sushi ". Ask for little rice when you order sushi. Get a booth so there is a bigger table and a better view.

Decided to give this a second chance. I wish I didn't.  Let's start with the open seating at the bar isn't because seats were reserved.  The people next to me were loud, drunk and obnoxious screaming and slamming everything on the bar and the restaurant did nothing to stop them.  The food was just ok but the experience made it not worth it at all.

We stopped in for dinner as a group of 4 (2 couples).  We were happy to see the $24.99 price included 8 oz of Sake too!  The server was GREAT!  He was very helpful and explained the menu and each item he was going to bring out.  He went into great detail when describing the food, which made for a great experience!    Overall the food was really nice!  Many items had fresh, unique flavors!!  The beef tenderloin items were amazing!  Definitely a MUST TRY when in the area!!!!

Just how much sushi do you think you can eat for 25.00??  Challenge accepted!!  3 rolls and I tapped out lol...  good decent sushi here for Vegas standards and prices.  As usual here at the M resort, the service members just make you feel pampered and loved for no apparent reason other than here you are in their house.  The drinks at this particular spot are splendid.  I had a guava mojito and it took my senses to the next level of deliciousness.  You will see me again!!

The night we went to this restaurant it was understaffed as the assistant manager was serving us. We didn't really mind that but where they really failed is how they served us. It is an all you can eat sushi place with hot food as well. When you order for some reason they bring everything to us all at once, even thought the plates can't even fit on the table! Also your warm food becomes cold. I did notify the assistant manager of this so hopefully that and this review will help them to change. Will not be going to an all-you-can eat at a casino again. Not worth it.

I got a few e-mails from The M announcing this new restaurant, which opened on Thursday.  Eric R.'s birthday is tomorrow, so we decided to celebrate on Saturday night here.  He was thinking sushi initially, and since this is not far from us and also has a sushi bar, we decided to check it out.  This is in the old Marinelli's restaurant spot and is very swanky.  There is a green light trim (the previous restaurant was red-lit).  Right when we were seated, Chef Seonkyoung Longest (winner of Restaurant Express on Food Network) was making the rounds of every table and we were next!  She was so friendly and talked to us about her restaurant, and she showed so much pride.  Our server was Doug and he is fantastic.  He was very friendly, informative, and personable.  We talked to him about dish sizes to make sure we were not over-ordering.  I started with a Yuzu Rita (yuzu juice, grand marnier, soju, simple syrup) rimmed with sea salt, and Eric R. had the Pacific mojito (in fact, 2 of them) AND jasmine green hot tea, which was by tea forte and in cute little pyramid infuser.  All of the serveware was very cool, with a theme of white wavy patterns.  The salt and pepper shakers were like puzzle pieces that fit together (our little marriage theme too, awww) and had white wavy patterns, the white napkins had this pattern across it, plates were rimmed with it, the tea pot also....soooo cute!  I liked it a lot!  Water glasses were stemmed jewel tone dark green which which was really cool and went with the green mood lighting.  We started with 2 apps, the duck sliders (5 spiced duck, cucumber, steamed bao with kaiware, cilantro and green onions to add) and Korean "street tacos" which was deconstructed: 3 scallion pancakes (wish there were 4!!!), bulgogi, cabbage in "kimchi sauce," and shredded vegetables (radish, peppers) with sriracha-lime sauce.  Chef Longest stopped by to check on us after we had our apps.  We told her our entree is the bimibap, and she cheerfully told us that her mom came on opening night and approved of the bimibap (FYI: Chef grew up in Korea).  Apparently this was one of the top dishes from the show that she made.  The bimibap was served in a beautiful bowl with the egg perfectly poached easy on top, with a side of the sauce.  The server wanted to mix it up with the sauce but Eric R. tasted it and felt the slow burn in his non-spicy palate.  We declined and I just mixed it with the poached egg.  We then split it and then I added the sauce.  Everything was sooooo good.  I loved the shiitakes in the dish.  Next, we ordered a little sushi: the Lady Luck Roll (salmon, tuna, hamachi on top, inside asparagus, gobo, avocado) and toro nigiri (3 pieces for $10, I think the 3rd was given to us for Eric R.'s birthday though).  The quality of the fish was excellent.  The maguro on the menu is bigeye and there is also blue fin tuna available.  For Eric R.'s birthday, he got a beautiful strawberry-white chocolate dessert with gold leaf on top that was just beautiful and delicious.  He loves both of those things so the restaurant nailed it.  However, the chef encouraged me to try the yuzu doughnuts because of my yuzu-love.  I guilted Eric R. into letting me get a 2nd dessert since he had 22 drinks and I had one.  The yuzu doughnuts came out pretty quickly.  They were described as yuzu-cream filled but they were actually not filled.  Also troublesome was the fact that they were room temperature.  I just expected warm to hot doughnuts.  They were just like room temperature dough drizzled with yuzu cream and topped with chopped pistachios.  The cream was fine (not as yuzu-y as the drink) but the temperature of the doughnuts just did not work.  Eric R. actually asked one of the chefs walking back toward the kitchen about it, and he immediately said they are supposed to be room temperature because otherwise the sauce would break.  I guess I personally didn't like it but other people might.  Just get the yuzu rita!!  Overall, service is great, the Chef is really enthusiastic, the ambiance is nice, and the food is excellent.  Also, the prices for food and drink are very reasonable ($8 for a specialty cocktail!) We will definitely return!

This spot feels like a well kept secret from tourists. Its ambiance is relaxed and modern. The choice menu consists of simple dishes, but when presented and tasted, it is anything but ordinary. Taste profile is full of complexity and wild. You won't regret coming here.

I ate here on 2/6. Here is how it went down... Came off of the road to grab a bite to eat before we drove into Vegas...We get to the restaurant about 15 minutes after they opened. The hostess told us that we had to wait 30 minutes to sit at the sushi bar...We weren't happy to hear this as we had been on the road for hours and we didn't see a whole lot of people in the restaurant. The manager witnessed the situation and walked over and showed us to a table (he must have seen the disappointment on our faces) which was REAL cool! Not sure what that deal was...but we ran with his offer and thanked him kindly.  We got seated at a larger table  that was in somewhat close proximity to the kitchen which was ok with us because we were starving. The restaurant has a nice ambiance with a touch of class.   We opted for the all you can eat sushi menu which was about $25 that came with free hot sake...The menu had about 6 appetizer choices, about 8-10 sushi roll choices and about 10 Nigiri choices. I started off with pork egg rolls which came out with the quickness and they were delicious...then I went on to the steamed pork bun...which I have never eaten, but remember friends munching on them at school...It wasn't my cup of tea...I'm sure it would be good to someone is accustomed to eating them. It was fresh and hot though. I had a rainbow roll and a surf and turf roll and both were EXCELLENT...Good quality fish! I didn't have room for anymore food....but I do look forward to going back and trying more of their sushi choices. Speaking of choices...if you are a person that likes a lot of variety when it comes to sushi, this may not be your spot...I'm not very particular about sushi selections (for me, the plainer the better- it's more about quality) when it comes to sushi so I will definitely make this a regular stop on my way to Vegas.

I'm basing the one star on the horrible service when you walk up. The property has really taken a dive since the new owners took over. The Food Network girl that took over this restaurant I don't blame her but service of the people that they have hired  to run it is absolutely atrocious. Just asked one of the customers how the food was when they walked out they said don't waste your life so there you have it

Best sushi place I've been. The price is reasonable and all of there rolls are delicious. I personally prefer the rolls over the nigiri but that's my taste. Even so their nigiri were also delicious. Going back to the rolls, each roll is creative and has unique flavor. I don't even like shrimp and one their rolls with shrimp tempura was absolutely delicious. My personal favorite would be the surf and turf.  The atmosphere is clean and contemporary, just the way I like it and the staff are very kind and attentive. One tip though, since every sushi is hand crafted to order, it's recommended to order while dining on you current sushi to reduce waiting time for the next round. Will definitely visit again every time I'm on my Vegas vacation.

The staff was really nice and the atmosphere was great. Their deserts are awesome. We did the AYCE option but we didn't get much out of it. There wasn't a lot of variety or options and my mom was disappointed that they didn't have hot or cooked sushi. Also, we could only do full rolls not half so even though the selection was small we got too full try give more things a try. They had a citrus roll however that was awesome. My usual sushi restaurant doesn't have that so that was the highlight of the meal really.

We were very excited to try Chef Longest's food after watching her win Restaurant Express. We loved everything. We tried several of the appetizers and side dishes. Our favorites were the Street Tacos, Duck Sliders and especially the Crab Salad. We will definitely come back the next time we're in Vegas!!!

Our first vist to this restaurant. Our waiter was very helpful and explained the menu to us. We all opted for the all you can eat sushi roll. It also includes edamame, cucumber salad and miso soup. The waiter suggested we start with 2 rolls.... which was a good idea. There was a great variety of rolls and none were overly spicy. The waiter checked us often to see what we wanted to order. This is a nice option for sushi that doesn't  break the bank. Will definitely return to Jayde Fusion!
I'll give them 4 but the service is slow.  Food not bad but not the most creative.  Beats eating the buffet here

I was at an event being held at the M Resort and decided to try the sushi restaurant within the hotel as this was one of the 6 options available. The restaurants in M Resort operate at rather odd times from my perspective but perhaps it's because I don't gamble. This place is open from 5-10pm which probably should have been a sign about the quality.  Not so Good: - Sushi was fishy in smell and taste. This is often more apparent to me as I order sushi that is straight forward and without sauces, so when the fish isn't great I taste it and then douse it with lemon.  - You have to pay at least $25 even if you are only getting 1 sushi role.  Good: - Service was friendly and accommodating, I ate at the  bar where I was looked after promptly. - You can order takeaway of up to 6 roles for $25 - They offer Skye Ginger vodka which I love and was a great match to the sushi.  I would not search out this spot for sushi and would only go back for a vodka ginger cocktail which is why I'm giving 2 stars.

Love Love love!! The service was great, the food was fantastic and the drinks are not too pricey. We decided to go with the All you can eat and it was totally worth every penny. Thinking this is going to be our new couples date night spot!
All you can eat sushi and Asian food for 32 bugs and really delicious!! Come here with a big appetite though. Located in the M casino. Recommendable if you love sushi!!!

The service was good and the venue is nice, however it's very medocre non-authentic asian food at best.  All you can eat where you can choose from the sushi buffet, chinese buffet, or both.  The food is ordered rather than actual buffet style where you get up and grab it yourself so it does take a little while to get your food.

At the bar, Brittany, my server, was on point.  A suitable and expansive menu stands to satisfy any taste, understanding the projected image of the restaurant.  Hamachi sashimi starter amply offered sprouts, wasabi along with mild and comforting hamachi.  The butter lettuce salad delivered a wholesome aroma of rice vinegar, but not at all overwhelming.  Representing an effort to 'eating healthy'.  The ribs were served Korean-style cut with a sweet-without being cloying sauce dressed gently.  This was a feast!  Billed as "small plates", there was no short service on this night.  Conversation with a couple from "across town" in Summerlin, combined with a splendid taste treat, made the night extraordinary.  Las Vegas is not what most people perceive.  There's a lot more here than gaming.

I have eaten here on multiple occasions. This place is an Asian cuisine(Chinese,Thai,Japanese etc.)/ sushi AYCE restaurant. Often when I eat here I opt for the Asian cuisine without the sushi makes it cheaper and to be honest there are better sushi places than this location. The Asian cuisine is above average the sushi average. Whenever we eat here we definitely always order the honey walnut prawns and what ever specialty dish they might. Last week it was "Hamachi Kama" aka yellowtail collar, it was very well prepared and the sauce they paired with it perfect!!! Also this place is very beautiful the ambiance and decor set it apart from other places!!! The best thing about this dinning location would have to be the STAFF!! Every time I have been here they have been nothing but pleasant! Kind and attentive is what truly makes me come back!   So two things they could improve on!! 1. The sushi!! 2. Outdoor seating cause I think that would be awesome!!

Horrible service, small servings, overly priced. The three of us ordered the won ton soup, kimchi fried rice and the Korean japchae. When the food arrived we were 1) surprised at the small portion size and 2) found that they had forgotten about the japchae order. Instead of checking on us after we received our incorrect order, our waitress (Iris) avoided our table even after making eye contact with her twice. The two of us who received our orders waited for the third order to arrive (the polite thing to do). Fast forward 15 minutes...no third order and no Iris to be found. At this point, our food was cold and we were getting irate. Kyle, who I assume was the manager on duty, tried to smooth things over with us but it was too late. We had lost our appetite waiting for our incompetent server to appear. He comp'd our meal, which was nice of him. But we definitely won't be going back after the poor service and small portioned dishes.

I didn't really care for the food here. It was lacking in flavor. The options are extremely slim on the sushi side. The server was terrible. I had to keep asking her for the same thing over and over again.   The only nice thing about this place was the dcor. Really nice looking restaurant.   I would not recommend this place at all.

We were really impressed with Jayde Fuzion.  It was a Thursday night, and we couldn't decide where to eat.  After perusing the menus of most of the restaurants, we decided to give Jayde a shot.  This is a large room, with what I presume is a nice view when the sun is shining.  The chairs were VERY comfortable, which was a surprise given that they didn't have armrests, and I usually prefer an armrest.  I sunk right into this chair, and it was the perfect height for the table.  We decided to go with small plates/appetizers to share.  We had (in my order of preference):  Kalbi ribs, Korean street tacos, BBQ pork buns, rock shrimp tempura, and crispy fried chicken skewers.  The ribs were fantastic, slathered in a sweet sauce that had enough heat, and they got a nice char from the grill.  I could have easily eaten the whole plate myself and added another.  Also, I felt the order size was very fair given the price.  My second favorite were the Korean street tacos.  You get 3 to an order, and quite a bit of beef.  The sriracha lime sauce went great with the beef and crispy veggies.  They are served with a scallion pancake, which I didn't really taste.  But, the rest of the dish was so great I didn't miss it.  The buns were solid, but it was a lot of bun to not much filling.  The rock shrimp was pretty standard, you can get this dish a lot of places.  They are served with a sort of thai chili sauce, which was great, but like I said, it's pretty standard.  The chicken skewers were a miss for us.  We didn't care for the sauce, and the chicken wasn't (or didn't appear to be) seasoned prior to frying.  These were way better than what you would get at a fast food joint, but we were not in a fast food joint.  So, I expected more.  Service was attentive, and they took a great team approach.  Plates were constantly taken off of our table, and we never went long needing a refill.  We'd certainly eat here again.

My wife and I came in to try this place, and it does look pretty cool. The night we dined, there appeared to be a staff shortage. We had a server that was focused on a massive table of people, and since that's the big tip ticket hey, I get it. We ordered an appetizer that never arrived and we did have to bring it up to get it off our bill.   What really bothered me was the food. It just wasn't that good. One roll I liked while the others were just...whatever.   What really prompted me to write this review was the fact I just bought some sushi for lunch from Sprouts for $13. It came with 3 different rolls, and I enjoyed each of them quite a bit. It's disappointing I dropped $120 for a meal that just wasn't very good compared to grocery store bought Sushi.

We had a great dining experience at Jayden Fuzion. The sushi was excellent, we had the egg rolls, chow mein and Kung Pao chicken which were all good - they have an all-you-can-eat price for sushi, Jayden specialties, or both together. I highly recommend this restaurant

Jayde was one of our favorite restaurants up until recently. They have started playing with the menu and changing the offerings. We loved the cucumber salad with greens, now they offer it with no greens, so it's mostly just sliced cucumbers. Bad idea. Also they've gone to an all you can eat menu,  I don't dislike that idea but in doing so they have dropped some favorites from the menu. No more Cashew chicken, no more Singapore noodles. They are slowly ruining what was a great restaurant.
Impeccable service and the food was great. We had the street tacos and the tempura. We can't wait to come back and try something else.

I'll keep this short and sweet. We showed up on a Saturday night a couple of weeks ago for the all you can eat sushi portion and truly I've never had more dismal sushi or even worse service in a long long time. The waiter forgot my drink and he forgot our calamari. The sushi literally tasted old and fishy and was so unappetizing we did not have more than a few rolls each and left hungry. We could only leave after waiting 30 minutes for the check. This is not acceptable. I was trained to cook myself by a European trained chef so when I go out to eat and get pathetic and tasteless food like this, it's beyond frustrating. This place has gone down dramatically now it's no longer in the hands of the Marnell family. Just like Harrah's  destroyed the Rio, also formerly owned by the Marnells. People that know the Vegas of today have no idea how amazing it actually used to be. They actually enjoy some of the slop that is served up in these casinos. It's not good, it's freaking wretched. Of course you'll see some good reviews on here because obviously there's a lot of people out there that just like cheap and are not looking for actual quality. They just want to save money and slurp some beers. The thing is though, it was still over $100. Save your money and go anywhere but this place as I assure you, you'll be glad you did. Go to local places individually owned by families as it's the only way to get great food these days. I'll shamelessly plug for Sushi Mon here for a decent AYCE place. I do recognize that this place was not meant to be five star but this was beyond awful.

I've dined at The M many times and I'm not sure how I've missed this spot. Simple delicious sushi, great "fusion" options, and the ambiance was fantastic. Very inexpensive for such a gorgeous property, I'll be back.

I'm not sure what happened to this place since I was there 5 months ago but it was horrible last night. The service was worse than SLOW. We ordered 2 piece unagi and it took over 30 minutes to get it.  We ordered other things and those came quicker. This is what we ordered... honey walnut prawns- basically shrimp tempura and heavily breaded. There was about a tablespoon of sauce for 5 prawns.  Calamari- way over cooked, so rubbery we left 3/4 of the plate. Korean street tacos- flavorless and it tasted more like a cabbage taco than a beef taco. It came with 3 tacos. We ate 1/2 of one and left the rest. Chicken Pad Thai- sauce and noodle were good but the chicken was so dry and over cooked couldn't even swallow it. Left about 3/4 of dish uneaten. All the sushi rolls were good, some lacked flavor but it was MUCH better than the cooked food.  Based on my most recent visit, I won't be returning.

Went with my wife on a whim, no reservation. They said they had no tables for an hour but we could get on wait list at sushi bar. So we did. Waited 10 minutes, not a problem. When we sat down the bar was packed (18 seats I think) and there wasn't a bartender in site. Apparently they have to go deliver drinks to the restaurant. What? Anyway, after 5 more minutes we got menus. I got a ginger drop martini, eh, not very good, Beth had iced tea.  We ordered 2 apps, Korean Street Tacos and chicken Lettuce wraps. The tacos were like little pancakes with beef and lettuce and some radish type stuff with a nice spicy sauce. We liked these very much. The lettuce wraps were a bit greasy and needed either a sauce or something crunchy. They were not as good as PF Changs. Entrees were beef chow mien, spicy seafood noodle and shrimp/sausage fried rice. The beef chow mien was awesome (except there really was not very much beef) noodles were cooked perfectly and they had a nice sweet flavor with red peppers , book Choy and mushrooms. The spicy noodles were as advertised very spicy, there was small shrimp and clams, it was all in a bowl with lots of broth. There  could have been more noodles, they looked like ramen noodles. The spice was excellent and lasted on my lips about 3 minutes after finishing. The shrimp and sausage fried rice may have been the best we ever had. We had yuzu donuts for desert they had a cool lemony filling and were kind of sweet, they were pretty good. As far as the "extras" well, there was no soap in the women's bathroom and no hook in the stall to hang a coat. There is a small sink at the sushi bar which is right next to the ice they use to make drinks. Well, when the servers bring old glasses back to the bar the bartenders just chuck whatever is left in the glass into the tiny sink and yep you guessed it the remnants splash into the ice. That's bullshit. I was never asked if I wanted another drink. The bar back filled my water glass most of the time, not sure if that's his job or not. The bill was $81, we had a $10 coupon that probably every Las Vegan got seeing as the owner of the place won Restaurant Express on Food Network and they are marketing it full force. We also paid with M points as it is in the M hotel and casino so the final cost was $65, we left 18 percent tip. We'd go there again but probably only if it was comped.

Hands down the best contemporary Asian restaurant in the Henderson/Las Vegas area.  I came here with my family. Since it's a Wednesday night, the restaurant wasn't that full. Everything in the restaurant, from the food to the presentation of the restaurant, is very well-done. The waiters were very nice to us, and they even explained some items that were on the menu as well as some items that weren't on the menu. They also came by our table a few times just to check up on us and ask about the quality of the food. The food was also brought out very quickly.  Every food item on the menu is made to share with others, so I recommend coming with a group instead of with just one other person. I can't recommend just one menu item because all of the items I've had were really good. I had the duck sliders, the Korean street tacos, the M Girl roll, the spicy tuna hand roll, the Surf n' Turf roll, and the chow fun. Savor each bite you take out of every food you eat because there is so much to taste, especially in the sushi. The only bad thing I have to say is that the chow fun noodles are chewy, but the beef in the chow fun is just plain savory and excellent. The strawberry shortcake we had for dessert was heavenly.  Even though the M Resort is pretty out of the way, and the food can get pricey, I strongly recommend coming here at least once.

Finally got a chance to come check this new restaurant out.  We come to the M Resort a lot but we tend to do the same things over and over.  Yesterday we both were in the mood for some Japanese food and decided to try out Jayde.  We were both very happy with the choice.  Our food, service and drinks were amazing.  They have some great AYCE options at around $25.    We had plenty of sushi, sashimi, sake and a couple cold beers.  Very good atmosphere and the customer service is great.

First of all, the service here is awesome! Our server, Kirk is awesome and very helpful and always checking up on us. He's made a lot of great advices for our selection and he did not disappoint.  I would definitely come back here for the awesome food and the great service!

Food was good. Had all you can eat sushi was worth the $24.99 prices of thing that we were disappointed with was the rice was soggy. Too much water when they cooked it's but everything else it was good . Ambience was awesome . Service was awesome. Would definitely go back again

The service was the poorest that I have ever received. I spoke to the manager about it at the end of the evening and he did nothing about but apologize. Food was nothing special. I will not be returning.

Just ok. We got the All you can eat menu. California roll and tiger roll not good. Tasted very old. Korean tacos not to bad. The best thing was honestly the fried rice. Very fresh and a good taste. The Chinese fun noodles were spicy but has a really good flavor and the beef in it was moist. Took awhile to get our check but I guess it was a Saturday night so it was to be expected. The miso soup was also good and a large portion. Not bad overall for 32 bucks a piece.

All you can eat sushi for $25, even on a limited menu, is a good deal. That, and the complimentary bottle of sake per person earns this place my admiration.  Also, no limit on number of rolls you can order at once.  Tasty sushi, great ambient music, professional atmosphere, good price... I'll visit again.

Terrible service. I had came here for dinner with family and we all placed our orders: won ton soup, kimchi fried rice, and japchae. The food that arrived: 2 orders of won ton soup and kimchi fried rice. The person who brought the food came with 2 orders of won ton soup and kimchi fried rice. There was a very clear mistake that was made but the server just looked a little confused and took the second bowl of own ton soup back. No apologies or acknowledgment of an error was made. I assumed that he went back to get my order so I waited...and waited. No one came back to check on our table, and when we tried to get the attention of our waitress, she avoided us like the plague.   Needless to say, I did not get my meal and by the time we got someone's attention, the other people in my party had finished eating. We complained to the manager and left.   As far as the food goes, the won ton soup had a measly 2 won ton in it and the kimchi fried rice (which I had tasted) was absolutely nothing to write home about. It was mediocre at best. They really should tout the head chef as a tv-competition winner with food like that, and she should be ashamed of the servers who bring down her name.   Bottom line, this place was very disappointing.

This place is an all-you-can-eat sushi restaurant now. The menu is divided into 3 parts in which the first two options are limited, thereby less expensive than the last option. We picked the first option (with the nigiri and rolls) and sampled all of the Nigiris along with two rolls:  orange crush and surf and turf. Everything was decent, not great. I don't think I want to come back here.

An interesting spin on fusion and buffet dining.  Environment: Located in the M Casino, the exterior as well as the interior of the restaurant are beautiful. The inside is spacious and has an abundance of seating from regular tables, to private dining areas, and beautiful patio overlooking the pool, and even a sushi bar with some stools.  Food: The food is more all-you-can-eat sushi style than buffet in that a waiter takes your order and the food is brought to your table. However, it is one flat price, and you can choose between the Chinese section of the menu, the Japanese section of the menu, or a combination of both for a small additional charge. We went for the combination and were delighted that we could order dumplings, pho, walnut shrimp, and sushi all at once. While this may seem like somewhat of a random mashup of diff3erent types of cuisine, each was respectable. The fish was very fresh for the sushi and the honey walnut shrimps were crispy and succulent. Additionally, the portions were not too big which allowed us to pace ourselves and never get to a point where we were unable to finish the food we had ordered.  Service: Service was very good as well. It leaned more to the fine dining type of service which was nice and out waiter was very prompt in checking up on us and taking any additional orders we may have wanted to place.  Overall, Jayde Fusion provides a great reason for locals to go all the way out to the M hotel and I will likely be back soon.

After eating at numerous locales in Vegas, we decided to try this one as it was in the hotel that we were staying in. The great and powerful "M" resort.  The Korean street tacos were so good that we had to have two orders every time that we visited and we visited four times in three days. The prices are so reasonable and everything that we had was soooooo good. My boyfriend tried at least four dishes every visit. The only thing that I did not like was the sushi and that is because I don't like it.

For a restaurant touted for unique fusion cuisine I found it rather underwhelming. We ordered flat noodles, fusion lettuce wraps, and dim sum siao mai. The wraps had buffalo wings type meat in them along with kim chi and rice. I wasn't a fan as the meat was dry and the rice just made the entire dish drier. Hole in the wall komex does the same thing but much better. The other dishes were pretty good but nothing spectacular. I could find equally good foods in china town easily.   Nice decor though.

Gave this place a try. Service was a little Slow, sushi was pretty good but limited menu. Also ordered the basic beef and broccoli. I would not recommend unless you like oily beef and limp broccoli. I POURED the grease off my plate.   The chef was good about offering a replacement but by that time I had lost my appetite.

This was my 4th time here and I think that this is one of the best restaurants in Vegas! Less than a reasonable buffet and I give it a 10 for the way they prepare each meal. My favorites and must try dishes....Jayde Specialites: Ribs, Mongolian Beef, Korean Beef Tacos, Orange Chicken, Honey Walnut Shrimp, Chicken Chow Mein, Pho are all great dishes but honestly all of them are delicious. Service is great as well and food comes right away.   My only complaint,  as I was leaving the restaurant I noticed a dirty looking dog sitting at the table with a couple right behind me. How disgusting!  Dogs have a place and a nice restaurant like this is not a place for dogs, unless a service dog, however this truly wasn't a service dog.  I'm truly disappointed in the restaurant allowing this and may not revisit nor continue referring people here.

Terrific Asian-inspired dishes. We opted for the Chinese plates, there are 13 of them.  Spring roll, tempura shrimp, potstickers, crispy lemon chicken. honey and walnut prawns were all good.  But the star of the night were the Korean Street Tacos! Wrapped in scallion pancakes, I could have eaten three dozen of these delicious packets.  I'd recommend this spot.  We made it through 6 chinese plates before we hit the wall.  Gotta go back and complete the list!

Loved the layout of this restaurant. It was very elegant and had exquisite floral pieces at the entrance. The staff was very attentive and efficient when serving the dishes. The sushi was very fair priced for AYCE with AYCD saki. Only $24.99! The only drawback for me was the small selection of sushi to choose from on the menu. Other than that I would definitely recommend sushi lovers to try this place out. :)

Quality of fish remains fresh however the sushi rice was hard & crunchy this visit & yellowtail looked extremely hacked up. Also the amount of rice being used is much larger than normal.  I hope they figure out these little hiccups because they really do make a difference in the enjoyment overall.  I'll go back again because the fish really is fresh & tasty but there are other places that always hit the mark as well such as Sushi Mon.
Ian is the best... he recommends what fits you. Sj at the bar make perfect sushi rolls. Not too big, just perfect

This is a real gem hidden in plain sight.  I rarely think of venturing into a casino for a real dinner treat that isn't going to break the bank.  Jayde Fuzion, the creation of the Restaurant Express winner, Seonkyoung Longest finds its home in the M Resort.    First off, the prices are more in line with what you would expect to pay on Spring Mountain with most dishes priced $7-14.  This is a fun spot to grab a group of friends and order a variety of dishes for sharing, which allows you to try more tasty dishes.  We loved everything that we tried; you really can't go wrong here.  Some of my favorite dishes are the pork belly lettuce wraps, crab salad, 5 spice duck sliders on bao buns, and the kalbi.  On our next adventure here I plan to try the bibimbap.

I decided to try this sushi place after seeing signs all over town for the $25 all you can eat. Which is the going price in Vegas.  The atmosphere is awesome. That is why I gave 2 stars.  I was seated at the sushi bar and was quite rudely told I had to sit at a certain seat for some bs reason.  I sit down and there are 5 employees behind the counter discussing sex life drama. They are using vulgar language that I could hear perfectly.  After 10 mins of sitting and being ignored, one waiter comes over to me and explains if I want to order I have to fill out an order form. Seriously? I told him what I wanted and he goes on and on about filling out order forms.  I had salmon and it was slimy. And I know slimy fish = old fish.  At the end of my eating once again all the male staff is behind the counter discussing who they want to bang.  Guys using vulgar language to decribe the female private parts is ok at home when hanging with your buddies BUT AT AN UPPERCLASS RESTAURANT??!!!   I will not be back!
Excellent sushi, excellent Korean street tacos.  Food was served fresh and fast.  Wait staff was very attentive to all our needs, bus people kept our table clean.

I didn't know what to expect when we walked in, but I am so happy I did.  We were given a booth near the kitchen.  The experience was special from the hostess seating us, the wait-staff being funny, helpful, knowledgeable, and witty.  I like that in a wait-staff.  People who are there and make it obvious they love their job.  The owner who won the contest spent some time at our table, sharing her life story, talking about the new venture she has in store and giving us recommendations on what to order.    We had so much food on our table.  Spring Rolls, soup, pork buns, duck sliders, fat noodles, kimchi, chocolate banana egg rolls.  Everything was so good; it truly is hard to pick out what my favorite was.    I would like to come back and try new dishes.

The hostesses were confused or not totally instructed to direct people to their tables.  The food was actually not bad although when trying to sit I had the favor of having my fingers laced with the previous persons sauce from their meal on my hand. Other than that we the prices are too much for what you actually get. But overall the food wasn't bad.  Jayde did come out to greet her guests which was not bad but wished she did a bit more but smile and tell us to comeback after we told her about the fish scales my partner got when eating his Snapper.

We sat at the sushi bar and got all you can eat sushi.  The ngiri was lame.  Every piece of fish was too long to dip in the soy sauce dish.  They were also much too thick, which completely changes the flavor profile for the worse.   I thought I got stabbed in the lip from a splinter on my chopsticks, but turns out it was just the Albacore ngiri, which had bones in every piece...  We should have just walked out right then. I'll leave it at that.  There is nothing special about this sushi restaurant.  I highly recommend this restaurant watch Jiro Dreams of Sushi.  Pretty clear what you are doing wrong.

This is must when in Vegas. Their Geisha, M Girl,  Surf & Turf, and Jayde  rolls are always on my list. The presentation of each roll too pretty to eat.  They have an assortment of dishes like the Korean Tacos and  the Lemon Chicken will have your mouth watering. Food always fresh and consistently delicious. Lets not forgot about the sake, I prefer Hakutsura Nigori. Our waiter and their staff are very pleasant and helpful, the service is wonderful they work together to get the empty plates off the table and such. Always a good night there.

Jayde Fusion - Dinner for 2  - We Ordered:   1) Roasted Shiitake Mushroom soup - arrived lukewarm. Although the seasoning and taste was very good the temperature was barely tepid; the bowl was littered with soup drippings along the sides as though it had been tossed about and the soup itself had formed a congealed film along the top giving the appearance the bowl sat for an extended period of time until it cooled beyond the correct temperature to be served. After a couple tastes, it was obvious that the soup sat too long so I mentioned this to the server who apologized and promised to bring a fresh, hot bowl. It seemed to take an unnecessary amount of time to bring back the soup which arrived much later than the entre of my companion - and again, the soup arrived barely warm.  2) Grilled Chinese Five Spiced Lamb Chops - 2 chops smothered in a brown sauce that disguised the fact that the chops contained nearly no meat but were rather all bone and fat - really awful. I've purchased from my local market and prepared at home far better lamb chops that were extraordinary in comparison to the sad chops served by Jayde Fusion.  3) Korean Street Tacos - odd combination of ingredients resulting in an easily forgettable taste and gastric experience; edible at best.   Overall, the service was okay but our meals were not served at the same time, creating a situation where one person received their dinner well ahead of the other making for an awkward and uncomfortable situation - did not appear very professional; overall, given the final cost, not a restaurant I would revisit anytime soon.
Food is pretty awesome ( surf&turf roll) and the service from everyone was great. I am however wondering what a service charge is for????
