My background: Eat out at least 2 times a week(many fine dining), love to cook and really enjoy delicious food and a great dining experience  Good : Nice atmosphere. Server tried to act nice.  Bad : Pretty much everything else - Service: Server was not knowledgeable of the menu. Slow service. Did not seem to really care about us at all. Food was dropped on us and the individual seemed to not give 2 shits. - Food : We tried multiple dishes and everything was OK. Nothing stood out at all. Everything was relatively bland. Nothing came out hot, just room temperature really. I would not expect this quality for the price; actually I would not expect this quality for any amount of money. I can go somewhere else and  pay 10 bucks and get a meal that tastes 10 times better than this nonsense.  - Overall : I really do not understand the hype. The head chef is some kind of contest winner of what not, but the food does not reflect that. Perhaps the people she is directing are not following through?.  I am not writing this to hate on the place (I love M casino and have been going there for years), but just hoping others with good taste will see this and not have the same bad experience we had. What really sucks is this was my wife and I's anniversary dinner :(
Great atmosphere, good food, decent prices, service is average. The egg rolls were above average, and the kimchi rice was superb. My companion had the Chinese fried rice and was not disappointed.

Service: Impeccable. Waiters were extremely nice and when they heard we came to see the Chef, they brought out Chef Longest to take a picture with us!   4 stars because the food was honestly nothing special but still very good.  Bibimbap: Just like your everyday normal Korean bibimbap but with the bumped up prices.  Kimchi Fried Rice: I thought it was called kimchi fried rice...not just plain old rice because that's what it tasted like. Severe lack of seasoning.  Crab Lettuce Wrap: Crab was really good and the sauce paired nicely with the crab and lettuce wrap however we were at lost with what to do with the wonton crisps it came with.  Samgyeposal Lettuce Wrap: ***This is the most bang for your buck*. Delicious and filling!  The Chef was extremely enthusiastic and meeting her was truly a humbling experience. I wish nothing but the best for the Chef.

I really loved this restaurant.  We ordered edamame to start, along with the Korean street tacos and the asparagus tempura with preserved lemon.  I highly recommend both of these dishes, they were very good.  We got three sushi rolls - the M Girl, Fusion Roll, and I can't remember the name of the other one - all of them were excellent.  My husband had told them it was my birthday when he made the reservation, so they came out with a surprise dessert - some kind of mousse with red stuff on the outside and fresh strawberries.  It tasted just like a strawberry shortcake and it was also awesome.  Our dining experience was great - not only was the food good but I thought the service was very good as well.  Many places we've been can't seem to get the mix right between being attentive and leaving us to enjoy ourselves, but this place did.  Enjoy!

I followed restaurant express so I was excited to try this restaurant . It was Friday so it was busy. The menu featured dishes she cooked on the show and some new stuff .  The waiter was very friendly and even talked about the show . Saying the kitchen in the restaurant was the kitchen they had the final competition. And he was even there for the final competition, which I thought was cool.  I got a teriyaki salmon and something called "fun noodles"- I can't quite recall the name  . They were amazing! You could definitely tell they use fresh ingredients.  As I'm eating . Seonkyoung longest (the winner) comes to our table and asks how the food is. I was so excited to meet her and told her I followed her on the show .  And was extremely humble and sweet. She was so grateful that her dream came true and you can tell she has a passion for food. She even took a picture with me ! Lastly for dessert . I got a while chocolate strawberry mousse . Which was different from anything I ever tasted . I highly recommend this restaurant. Not only for the food , but for the experience.

Used to love this place to start.  Last time I ate here, the miso smelled awful and fishy, the albacore was slimy with a bloody back, and really nothing tastes fresh.  The Uni and Blue Fin Tuna are now off the all you can eat menu, so I am guessing things at Jayde Fusion aren't going well.  Sorry to say, as this place used to have crazy fresh fish, maybe I caught them on a bad night, but unless something changes I won't be back.

Vegetarian and vegan friendly!  I had an excellent experience at this restaurant. The service was phenomenal, the ambiance was lovely, and the food was delicious.  I asked what options were available for someone who doesn't eat meat and the chef personally. He said they could do vegetarian or vegan options and he clearly knew what he was talking about when he explained exactly how he could make items on the menu vegan.  The actual dishes were so much better than I could have hoped for. I highly recommend this restaurant.

Don't waste your time.... Just walking into the place I was a bit confused.  They put the sushi bar, instead of the tables, in front of the amazing view of the strip.  Then I was seated at one of the most uncomfortable booths ever, it was right in front of the kitchen and throughout the meal we had to listen to the staff yelling out orders.  Sushi and roll selection was extremely limited, with majority of the rolls being spicy.  I have had better tasting sushi from Smith's.  Also the layout for the servers was all wrong... watched one guy literally running across the restaurant all night.

Dinner Service from 5PM. Overall Food was Good, Service Very Good, Ambiance Very Good, Fit for foodies, kid-friendly, for groups or special occasion serving Japanese Fusion and Chinese dishes. The cheap fast food chop sticks did not match the formal table cloth and silverware setting.  Comfortable buffet style seating but not busy. Excellent Waiter service.a PLUS. Large Tiger Prawns sere served in the Shrimp Tempura and Honey Walnut Prawns. Although the Calamari were not "Crispy" as described, it was deliciously tender. The Crispy Lemon Chicken was well done. The Chinese Friend Rice was a bit salty with the extra soy sauce added. They don't serve Uni, Lobster or raw squid.   As the restaurant name implies, Jayde Fuzion serves Chinese style Japanese delicacies for the American palate. The edamami had too much salt sprinkled. If you are conscious about salt and sweet, ask the waiter to separate the sauce. The waiter, Ian was very accomodating to serve the deep friend soft shelled crab without the rice roll. THIS IS DEFINITELY A PLUS. I would give this place FIVE STARS, had they served more sake and watermelon or fruit to balance the extra salty taste.   Altogether a good experience

We started off with they called Jayde Favorites. Well guess what? They are my favorites too. We started with the Chicken lettuce wraps. They were moist and flavorful.  They weren't skimpy on the portion sized either.   We moved onto the hot & sour soup.  Very delightful and to top it off they make their own tofu here.  So bold and so delicious.   Have you ever felt like a side of green beans? Me either, but I ordered them anyways and thank goodness we did.  Still had plenty of crunch to them which is a nice change from a doggy over cooked green bean.    Oh then they brought me a little teaser of kimchi.  Hello tummy here it comes.   If that wasn't enough goodness we got the Wagyu Beef Kalbi Ribs.  Oh yeah another winner. They were tender, juicy, and seasoned with the perfect amount of seasonings and top with a teriyaki sauce that wasn't one of those heavy over baring sauces.    Then to complete this buffet of happiness on our table we were also blessed with one if the better tasting Thai Basil Fried Rice.  Right up my alley no egg  We would totally come back

We got to eat at the famous Jayde Fuzion Restaurant at M Resort. It so happened that we were staying near the hotel when we found out that Jayde Fuzion had finally opened! We ordered a lot of the appys: - Samgyeposal Lettuce Wraps - really really good! - Korean Street "Tacos" - love 'em! - Five Spiced Duck Sliders - really good! - Ahi Poke - nice presentation with finely cubed tuna! Nice flavours. Entrees: - Chow Fun Noodles - Best chow fun I've had. Very subtle flavours. - Baby Bok Choy - very small plate of greens - Korean Style Lobster - lobster slit into half down the middle - unusual way to present Asian lobster - good flavours - Asian Sizzling Snapper - great fish dish! Desserts: - Yuzu Doughnuts - very good - Exotic Fruit Salad - very good  Some advice for the restaurant: - The plates are really heavy for passing around and the serving cutlery is so heavy that it doesn't stay on the plate when it's being passed round. it makes such a clatter when the cutlery falls on the table! - All the appys and entrees all came out at once as the waiter explained that the dishes are all done at once and when it's done, they come out. There was no space on the table when the dishes came out. It would be wise to instill a time management program to sort out the appys and entrees.  Biggest thrill: meeting the Restaurant Express winner, Executive Chef Seonkyoung Longest! A very nice and humble lady.

If that fantastic Korean girl who stated the restaurant ate there now she would cry. We tried the all you can eat Asian menu. I'm afraid to say that only two items were even fit to eat. They were the pot stickers and the street tacos. Everything else we didn't eat. The ribs were so hard we couldn't bite into them. The pad Thai was mushy and and the fried rice tasted and smelled terrible. Now let me say this, my wife is Asian and we're in Asian restaurants probably 4 days a week. This is one I will not return to. I asked the server if I could speak to the manager. She said she would but the manager never appea

Visited Jayde Fuzion on January 2nd after wanting to visit since the end of the show.  There were four of us dinning and we were sharing and trying many different types of food from the menu. I wanted to first wanted to say that our evening would not have been nearly as good if we hadn't had the privilege of having Doug as our server.  Doug knew the menu, answered all of our questions and even gave us suggestions.  He definitely made the evening an amazing experience. Even after we left, we forgot some items at our table and he ran us down before we left to make sure that we got the items. Thank you once again Doug!! To begin with drinks, the Plum Wine was delicious along with the green hot tea (amazingly alternating between these two drinks didn't affect the taste of either of them). We began with the California Rolls which all of the ingredients were so fresh and amazingly tasty. Next came the Duck Sliders and the Shrimp/Veg Tempura.  The Duck Sliders were covered in a delicious sauce and were not overly greasy like some duck dishes can be. The Shrimp/Veg Tempura was also delicious and everything in this dish was very fresh as well and was not over done with the breading. Then came the Korean Tacos and the M Girl Rolls.  The flavors for each of the ingredients were very well done and complemented each other impeccably, and the sauce that came with the tacos was scrumptious. In addition the "tortillas" used were so light and fluffy that you could eat these all night and not get full from the bread. I was worried about trying the M Girl Rolls since there were jalapeos in the roll since I can't do many spicy foods. However you couldn't feel the heat from the jalapeos and it really just added to the flavor of the rolls. Some of the main courses included the Emperor Fried Rice and Gochujang Pork. The Emperor Fried Rice had large chunks of crab meat and also gained some heat the more you ate.  Then the Gochujang Pork plate was delicious as well and the sauce that was covering the pork and the veggies was perfect and not over powering. I am a person who LOVES deserts and I will say that this place did not disappoint what so ever.  The Green Tea Creme Brle was absolutely scrumptious and it was the best tasting creme brle I have ever had, hands down.  We also shared the Lychee Ice-Cream which was also very delicious.

I have to admit that the restaurant has a great atmosphere and the decor is very impressive. (Minus the fact that I felt like I was in an Italian restaurant because the way the table settings are arranged) it must be because that used to be the spot for the Marinellis restaurant which served Italian food.   We went there because they have a "all you can eat sushi + free sake" there's a catch... The menu is super reduced and poor and almost every roll is just pure rice and a lot of nothing inside! Maybe 8 different cut rolls and the most simple ones. The flavor wasn't there and the stiff staff didn't help. Oh and if you order another round of sake, they charge you! Only one free sake per person. The all you can "kind of" eat is at the bar so there's like a dozen of seats only.   There were no Japanese customers in the restaurant which says a lot about the authenticity of their food.   Sad but not coming back.

Ordered rolls at the bar to go and have to say very disappointed. We ordered California roll and it tastes very plain and sushi rice not so good.we also ordered the M girl roll or so we thought I get home and it's a rainbow roll!!!Don't really recommend this place for sushi you are better off outside of the hotel and find a hole in the wall with better quality tasting sushi.

Let me start by saying, this is the first 1 star review I've ever given. That single sentence should speak for itself, but for those that prefer details please read on.  My girlfriend and I have been dying to try this place for sometime, the planets line up correctly and we decided to give it a go...   SERVICE-  We arrived at 5:30 on a weekday evening. the Hostess was friendly and somewhat prompt. as we we seated at our table, we noticed the Sushi bar was full but the dining room had vast seating. While the hostess selected for a very small table in direct sunset sunlight, we redirected her to a more spacious booth in a more comfortable area.  We were told the usual "your server will be with you in just a moment" ... 30 mins later no one had even taken our drink order. This wasn't because they were swamped, there may have been 8 tables occupied at the time, but because our server was more interested in being a social butterfly than attending to our table.  Once we complained, the Chef came out to apologize. Nice enough guy and I would've been alright with things except instead of acknowledging the poor service, he made the excuse for his staff that there had been a "simultaneous seating" which was FAR from true. At this point, I was truly looking forward to an exceptional and interesting meal. Oh the dreams of fools...  FOOD -  For Appetizers, we opened with the Grilled 5 Spice Lamb Chops and the Korean Street Tacos. Both were just okay. Not as much flavor as I was expecting/hoping for. Best thing was the salad that accompanied the Lamb Chops  Next we grabbed a couple of rolls of Sushi, The M Girl and a Geisha Girl. The sushi rolls were actually the best part of the meal and if by some odd twist of fate I end up in this place again, that is all I would have!  In the Rice/Noodles area we tried a couple of "hard to get wrong" basic dishes, Chinese Fried Rice and Pad Thai Noodles. Both of these dishes were horrible to the point of complaint. They were both flavorless and greasy/oily. Just really poorly prepared and we had them removed from the bill.  For entrees, we tried the Beef & Broccoli along with the Crispy Fried Tai Snapper. Both had potential, but the sauces used were just way too sugary and sweet. I swear, the sauce on the snapper tasted like a diluted, warmed, jam.  ATMOSPHERE  Most disappointing thing here wasn't even at our table, but directly in front of us. The hostess continued to seat patrons in a seating area where the refused to lower the blinds, though the dining area is surrounded by windows. We watched 3 sets of tables complain about the blinds while the 6:30-7:30 July western sun beamed down on them without mercy. No one in the establishment seemed to even care no matter what was said to them.  Enter this establishment only if want to extend a horrible night at the tables and make it even worse. Invested $150+ and gained the knowledge that I will never set foot in the place on my own accord again.

This is one of the best values in Las Vegas. The food is remarkably good, and the wait staff is friendly and efficient. It's all you can eat, but the food is prepared to order, so it's hot and fresh. I go here every time I'm in town and am never disappointed.

It was my husband's birthday, so his friend, him, and I go out to eat at Jayde since he loves sushi and has been dying to try this place out. We all order AYCE to make ordering much simpler. First, the AYCE menu is very very very limited. Dessert is not included as well. It's not like most AYCE sushi places where you can choose from most of the menu if not the entire menu.   Anyways, they have a sheet that you fill out with how many orders you want of this and that. We always keep track of what we're ordering and how much. We received at least three times the amount of nigiri that we ordered. We told our waiter, Georgio, this, and he blamed it on the kitchen staff. Okay... but then, we received twice the amount of rolls ordered, to which he blamed on our busser...in front of him. Poor guy! All he's done is fill our drinks & take empty plates away, not take our orders. Georgio has blamed everyone under the sea at this point but himself.   Finally it's time for the check. We are a part of 6, so we were charged an 18% gratuity fee - which is fine and expected in large parties. We explained to Georgio that we would need 4 separate checks (2 couples, 2 individuals), and he walked away to ring up our receipts. He comes back with 4 checks, but one of them being charged the 18% of the whole bill. So our friend is pissed that he's received the 18% & asked Georgio why it wasn't split up like we had asked. Georgio claimed that he could not put the 18% on everyone's bill, that it wasn't possible. So we asked for his supervisor, who didn't speak to us, only walked away with Georgio to ring up new receipts. 20 minutes later and the supervisor is still ringing up receipts, so the friend that was originally charged the 18% walked up to him & asked what was going on. The supervisor explained that our party never told Georgio to split the check and that we were in the wrong and that it was going to take a while to ring up new receipts with an 18% gratuity. Finally, we got our receipts, paid, and will never return.  We are avid sushi-goers and the sushi was not worth the drive, the waiter, or the money.

Fusion, a mix between mostly Americanized sushi and Chinese food.  This entire menu is all you can eat with no a la carte options.  Either get the $25 version of sushi and nigiri or their Jayde specialties- which are the Chinese inspired dishes.  If you want the mixture of the two, just pay about $7 more to order from either menu.    I opted for the sushi and nigiri and boy was I disappointed.  My first two rolls- Dragon roll and some eel roll, were all made with California roll and then topped with the various fishes based on the description.  I asked the waiter if there were any ones not California roll based and the manager was able to get about 6 rolls out of 12 options available.  Look, if you like sushi that comes from fast food or the like, you'll do fine here.  I was looking for a variety of sushi rolls with a little more refined taste, but apparently the price point should have led me to think California roll is standard.  Overload of teriyaki sauce in their rolls, no half orders available, this lends to a more wasteful environment than a tasting of the menu.  This was not a nice celebratory meal, but the ambiance and service were great.  5 stars for the service and Kirk was really awesome.

I typically avoid AYCE sushi restaurants. Actually this is only my second one but was highly recommended to me. The entrance to Jayde Fuzion is beautiful. It is nicely decorated and the sushi bar is in the back corner along the windows.   Jayde has 3 menus to choose from. All you can eat sushi ($24.95), all you can eat Chinese specialties ($24.95) or both for $32.95. The sushi was enough for us. All 3 menus include one small carafe of warm Sake. I did not care for it at all but I am not in to Sake.   The service overall was excellent. We arrived right at 5:00 when they opened and were of course seated immediately. You must sit at the sushi bar if you select the AYCE sushi menu. We were explained the menu and then given our included miso soup, cucumber salad and edamame. The miso was okay, I've had better.   We started with Hamachi, Toro and albacore sushi. We then ordered a spicy tuna roll, M girl roll (shrimp tempura, avocado, cream cheese, cucumber, jalapeno) and surf & turf (Kobe beef and spicy tuna). The sushi was very good, tasted very fresh.   The rolls however were just really plain. The spicy tuna was not spicy and the M girl had barely any jalapeno flavor. The surf and turf also lacked much flavor. If I didn't know what was in the rolls I could not have told you. For dessert we had the chocolate banana spring rolls which were excellent. A small scoop of ice cream would have been a perfect addition.   The service and decor are great, but the sushi is very average and the menu is quite limited with only 10 rolls. I will continue to be loyal to my two favorite sushi places, neither of which are AYCE.

I was so looking forward to trying this place. The decor is awesome.   Here comes the bad news i guess if you dont drink alcohol at this restaurant you get bad and slow service. They wanted us out of there pretty quick the waiter took one of our plates before we finished, they took our dishes pretty quick. The food was bland i couldnt believe it.   Overall i would not suggest this place unless you order drinks first. Maybe i should of worn a suit and tie.

The atmosphere and decor was great. We came for the all you can eat sushi for $24.95 + one small sake per person. The sushi menu was limited to ten rolls, nigiri, and sashimi, but sashimi is not included with the deal. The first three rolls we ordered: Geisha, Surf and Turf, and Jayde Roll, which was pretty decent.  The next three rolls: Lady Luck, M Girl, and Rainbow, which was blah...

We came here for AYCE - 24.95 plus free sake. * The AYCE menu is EXTREMELY limited: 9 small plates, 10 rolls, 10 nigiri choices (This is the wrost AYCE menu I have seen but then again I stay away from sushi in casinos.) * You get one large 'complementary' hot sake per person. (It was NOT hot; it was barely warm and cold after 10 minutes.)  Pros: The quality was good, not great. The rice was sticky.  Cons: * We could not tell the difference between the seaweed salad and cucumber salad. We had to ask the waitress which one was which. They were both 95% LETTUCE and rather nasty.. * Our waitress was not nice. * We tried ordering a second seaweed salad without dressing (thinking there might be more seaweed in this one...) and we received TWO cucumber salads. * The nigiri had A LOT of rice. So too did the rolls.  There are SO many better sushi places in Vegas, even if you have to pay for the sake! I think this is one of the worst sushi experiences I have ever had...

The food was okay but the service was terrible! I will never comeback to this place ever again. Manager looked like he doesn't know what the hell he was doing and the server was all over the place. We asked them for a high chair for one of the kids, the server came back 30mins later and just placed it behind us and left. I would understand if it was busy but not much people were there. Just an overall bad experience.

The food was 4/5 The service was 3.5/5 The advertisement was a lie! 0/5 It stated "all you can eat sushi and FREE sake"  The lie is that you get 1 free sake.  So I told my server that I felt I was conned and he did nothing... But he did admit that MANY patrons before me have expressed the same.  If the ad specified ONE free sake I still would have gone and likely rated this place better.   But it clearly wasn't just the ad that was deceiving.  There are plenty of ayce sushi places in Vegas that won't lie to you.  And will probably charge less than $10 for sake.  Pass on this one!

I wanted to try this place for the all-you-can-eat sushi, but found you have to sit at the bar and there was limited seating.  At least the waiter mentioned that the undersized food was family style.  The service was all right, but I left feeling dissatisfied due to the overpriced food.
